definition: mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: He subtitled his work with To Lady Carvier.
sentences.chinese: 他爲他的著作加上小標題爲“獻給卡里爾夫人”。

sentences.english: Change the colours for visited links, and use good headers.
sentences.chinese: 對已訪問連接使用不同顏色，用好大小標題。

sentences.english: Subheads should be placed in the middle of the column.; Centre the subheads.
He subtitled his work with  To Lady Carvier.
sentences.chinese: 他爲他的著作加上小標題爲“獻給卡里爾夫人”。

sentences.english: You have to use the people you write about as subheads.
sentences.chinese: 你必須用被描述人物作小標題。

sentences.english: This continues the point made under the previous two headings.
sentences.chinese: 這裏我們繼續前面兩個小標題探討的內容。

sentences.english: Fast reading. Read the passage and match the headings with the paragraphs.
sentences.chinese: 速讀課文，請爲每一段落選擇合適的小標題。

sentences.english: Headings and sub-headings further clarify the structure of the article.
sentences.chinese: 標題和小標題使文章的結構更加清楚。

sentences.english: Click on each myth to read a longer explanation of it.
sentences.chinese: 你們可以點擊每個小標題以閱讀更多的闡釋。

sentences.english: The remaining provisions of subtitle C relate to standards and enforcement.
sentences.chinese: 小標題C的其餘原則都與標準和執行有關。

definition: to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
security measures (esp. border security)/official seal (esp. military seal during Qing and Ming times)
Jinghai county in Tianjin 天津[Tian1 jin1]/Sea of Tranquillity (on the moon)
writing style in which the main subject is approached directly from the outset/opposite of 冒題|冒题[mao4 ti2]
a slip of a pen/CL:處|处[chu4]
